subject: Music
title: The Sonata Form
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Sonata Form usable.

hook.text: Sonata form is the blueprint behind almost every classical masterpiece you've ever heard.

buildup.text: It has three parts: exposition introduces themes, development transforms them, recapitulation resolves.

discovery.text: This structure creates dramatic tension â€” presenting ideas, scrambling them, then bringing order.

twist.text: Composers spent two centuries finding infinite variety within this single framework.

climax.text: From Haydn to Brahms, sonata form gave classical music its narrative backbone.

punchline.text: One simple structure. Two centuries of masterpieces.
